Fig 7 Entry feature with gabled roof

facade and top of
roof material
at ridge

Height

Height

Grade

Isometric View                Side Elevation                Porch Floor Plan

Note: If the entryway is considered to be a vaulted entryway
the area will be counted as follows:
• In this example, a portion of the entryway is recessed
  beyond the house facade and roof. It is included in the
  area that counts.
• The area is measured to the outside material of the entry-
  way feature.
• The area counts TWICE toward gross floor area.

Outline of entry-
way roof

Outline of entryway
floor area that counts
TWICE if entryway is
vaulted

12

visual_elements.description: Three architectural drawings showing an entry feature with gabled roof: 1) Isometric view showing a 3D perspective of a house entrance with gabled roof, windows, and dimensional arrows indicating height and grade measurements, 2) Side elevation view showing the profile of the entry feature with height and grade measurements marked, 3) Porch floor plan view showing the outline of the entryway roof and floor area from above

structural_elements.main_heading: Fig 7 Entry feature with gabled roof

additional_notes: Page number 12 appears at bottom left
Diagram includes measurement arrows and dimensional indicators
Text 'TWICE' appears in bold/emphasized formatting in multiple locations
